revision.text:
{| class="wikitable" !'''''[[Gluster_File_System_Documentation | Home!!]]''''' |} = Developers = === From GlusterDocumentation === == Contributing to the Gluster community == Are you itching to send in patches and participate as a developer in the Gluster community? Here are a number of starting points for getting involved. We don't require a signed contributor license agreement or copyright assignment, but we do require a "signed-off-by" line on each code check-in. * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Simplified_dev_workflow Simplified Developer Workflow] - A simpler and faster intro to developing with GlusterFS, than the doc below. * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Development_Work_Flow Developer Workflow] - this tells you about our patch requirements, tools we use, and more. Required reading if you want to contribute code. * [http://www.gluster.org/2012/05/glusterfs-license-change/ License Change] - we recently changed the client library code to a dual license under the GPL v2 and the LGPL v3 or later == Compiling Gluster == * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/CompilingRPMS Compiling RPMS] - Step by step instructions for compiling Gluster RPMS * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Building_GlusterFS Building GlusterFS] - How to compile Gluster from source code. Including instructions for Ubuntu. == Developing == * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Projects Projects] - Ideas for projects you could create * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Language_Bindings Language Bindings] - Connect to GlusterFS using various language bindings * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/EasyFix_Bugs EasyFix_Bugs] - Easy to fix bugs of GlusterFS. One of the best place to start contributing to GlusterFS. * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Fixing_Issues_Reported_By_Tools_For_Static_Code_Analysis Fixing issues reported by tools for static code analysis] - This is a good starting point for developers to fix bugs in GlusterFS project. * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Backport_Wishlist Backport Wishlist] - Problems fixed in the master branch might need to get fixed in stable release branches too. The [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Backport_Guidelines Backport Guidelines] describe the steps that are needed to provide patches. == Testing == * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Using_the_Gluster_Test_Framework Using the Gluster Test Framework] - Step by step instructions for running the Gluster Test Framework * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Jenkins_Infrastructure Our Jenkins Infrastructure] - A braindump of the Jenkins infrastructure we have in place for automated testing * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Jenkins_setup Manual steps for setting up a Jenkins slave VM in Rackspace] - Steps for setting up a slave VM in Rackspace == Bug Handling == * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Bug_reporting_guidelines Bug reporting guidelines] - Guideline for reporting a bug in GlusterFS * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Bug_triage Bug triage guidelines] - Guideline on how to triage bugs for GlusterFS * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Bug_report_life_cycle Bug report life cycle in Bugzilla] - Information about bug life cycle == Patch Acceptance == * The [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Guidelines_For_Maintainers Guidelines For Maintainers] explains when maintainers can merge patches. == Release Planning == We recently convened to plan the 3.6 release, the results of which you'll find in the link below. This is, of course, subject to change. * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Features Features Under Development] * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Planning36 GlusterFS 3.6 Release Planning] - this is our evolving roadmap for GlusterFS 3.6 == Release Process == * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/GlusterFS_Release_Process GlusterFS Release Process] - Our release process / checklist == Writing Translators == Translators are the most powerful way to extend GlusterFS. These stackable modules allow developers to easily add - or remove - features as they see fit. GlusterFS is, at its core, a toolkit for building new filesystems, with translators being the building blocks. * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Arch Architectural overview and Gluster internals] * [http://www.gluster.org/community/documentation/index.php/Translators All about translators] - including links to tutorials and current list of translator maintainers

{| class="wikitable" !'''''[[Gluster_File_System_Documentation | Home!!]]''''' |}
